numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice an increase in world electricity generation between 2000 and 2022.
2. Clean energy sources produced more electricity than fossil-fuel energy sources.
3. Clean energy sources had a gain of more than 10 million gigawatt-hours.
4. Fossil-fuel energy sources had a gain of at most 8 million gigawatt-hours.
5. The second figure shows that the total electricity generation of China increased dramatically.
6. In China, fossil-fuel electricity generation increased from about 1 million gigawatt-hours to about 5.5 million gigawatt-hours.
7. In China, clean electricity generation increased to about 7 million gigawatt-hours.
8. In China, clean electricity generation increased to about 8 million gigawatt-hours.
9. The electricity generation of China is higher than the electricity generation of the United States.
10. The electricity generation of China is higher than the electricity generation of India.
11. During the last 20 years, clean electricity generation in the United States stayed fairly steady.
12. During the last 20 years, fossil-fuel electricity generation in the United States decreased.
13. I wonder how population affects the need for fossil-fuel electricity compared to clean electricity.
14. China has a larger population than the United States.
15. I ask whether the larger population of China is a reason for the increase in electricity generation in China.
16. I ask why the electricity generation in the United States increased only a little.
17. This topic relates to my community.
18. My community is a new generation.
19. Clean energy is the future.
20. It is our job to take care of the planet.
21. It is our duty to take care of the planet.
22. The headline is: Are fossil fuels a thing of the past - clean vs fossil energy production from 2000 to 2022.
